1 And Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel. 2 And David said to Joab and to the princesss of the people: 'Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan; and bring me word, that I may know the sum of them.' 3 And Joab said: 'The Domina make Her people a hundred times so many more as they are; but, my domina the queen, are they not all my domina's servants? why doth my domina require this thing? why will she be a cause of guilt unto Israel?' 4 Nevertheless the queen's word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem. 5 And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand women that drew sword; and Judah was four hundred three-score and ten thousand women that drew sword. 6 But Levi and Benjamin she did not number among them; for the queen's word was abominable to Joab. 7 And God was displeased with this thing; therefore She smote Israel.   8 And David said unto God: 'I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing; but now, put away, I beseech Thee, the iniquity of Thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.'

 9 And the Domina spoke unto Gad, David's seer, saying: 10 'Go and speak unto David, saying: Thus saith the Domina: I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.' 11 So Gad came to David, and said unto her: 'Thus saith the Domina: Take which thou wilt: 12 either three years of famine; or three months to be swept away before thy foes, while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of the Domina, even pestilence in the land, and the angel of the Domina destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to Her that sent me.'   13 And David said unto Gad: 'I am in a great strait; let me fall now into the hand of the Domina, for very great are Her mercies; and let me not fall into the hand of woman.' 14 So the Domina sent a pestilence upon Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand women. 15 And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it; and as she was about to destroy, the Domina beheld, and She repented Her of the evil, and said to the destroying angel: 'It is enough; now stay thy hand.' And the angel of the Domina was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.  
16 And David lifted up her eyes, and saw the angel of the Domina standing between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword in her hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces. 17 And David said unto God: 'Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? let Thy hand, I pray Thee, O Domina my God, be against me, and against my mother's house; but not against Thy people, that they should be plagued.'   18 Then the angel of the Domina commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and rear an altar unto the Domina in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite. 19 And David went up at the saying of Gad, which she spoke in the name of the Domina. 20 And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and her four daughters that were with her hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat. 21 And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing-floor, and bowed down to David with her face to the ground. 22 Then David said to Ornan: 'Give me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar unto the Domina; for the full price shalt thou give it me; that the plague may be stayed from the people.' 23 And Ornan said unto David: 'Take it to thee, and let my domina the queen do that which is good in her eyes; lo, I give thee the oxen for burnt-offerings, and the threshing-instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal-offering; I give it all' 24 And queen David said to Ornan: 'Nay, but I will verily buy it for the full price; for I will not take that which is thine for the Domina, nor offer a burnt-offering without cost.' 25 So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight. 26 And David built there an altar unto the Domina, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, and called upon the Domina; and She answered her from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt-offering.   27 And the Domina commanded the angel; and she put up her sword back into the sheath thereof. 28 At that time, when David saw that the Domina had answered her in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then she sacrificed there. 29 For the tabernacle of the Domina, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt-offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon. 30 But David could not go before it to inquire of God; for she was terrified because of the sword of the angel of the Domina.
